titleStmt.title: A declaration of Lieutenant-Colonel John Lilburn to the free-born pcople [sic] of England. And his speech to the Parliament, on Tuesday last; in answer to the sentence denounced against him by Mr. Speaker, by speciall order and command together with his resolution (come life come death) not personally to yield active submission to the said sentence. And divers other remarkable things, worth the knowledge of all the free-men, not only of London, but of all England. Subscribed, John Lilburn.
titleStmt.author: Lilburne, John, 1614?-1657.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "January. 22. 1652"; also the last number of the imprint date has been marked through.
